cleaned_text: Childhood Immunizations The Prince Edward Island Immunization Program provides safe and effective vaccines that protect Islanders against some communicable diseases known as vaccine preventable diseases. Over the past 50 years the use of vaccines has prevented life threatening disease, disability, certain cancers and hospitalizations. Immunization provided to the population provides herd immunity, making it difficult for disease to spread from person to person. By getting immunized, you are protecting yourself and those around you who may too young, too old or too sick to be immunized. How can my family and I get vaccines through the Immunization Program? Children, under the age of 18 years or until the child completes high school, can receive vaccines at no cost. Immunization is delivered to children by [Health PEI Public Health Nursing offices ](/en/information/health-pei/public-health-nursing)by appointment or in scheduled visits to schools. [Adults ](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/en/information/health-pei/adult-immunizations)also need vaccines at certain times. You can be immunized at your local Health PEI Public Health Nursing office, your family doctor or nurse practitioner's office or a pharmacy, depending on the vaccine. Many adult vaccines are free, however there are exceptions. Travel immunizations for adults and children are not free of charge in PEI and are not available at Health PEI Public Health Nursing offices. Islanders are encouraged to contact a travel clinic for immunization as it relates to travel. Which vaccines are recommended for my child? Vaccines are given based on the age of your child. The immunization schedule currently in effect is: 2 months [DTaP-HB-IPV-Hib](/en/information/health-and-wellness/diphtheria-tetanus-pertussis-whooping-cough-hepatitis-b-polio-and) & [Pneumococcal Conjugate](/en/information/health-and-wellness/pneumococcal-conjugate-vaccine-13-valent) Rotavirus 6 DTaP-HB-IPV-Hib & (High also receive Pneumococcal Conjugate) [MMRV](/en/information/health-and-wellness/measles-mumps-rubella-german-measles-and-varicella-chickenpox) [Meningococcal & MMRV 4-5 years [Td-IPV](/en/information/health-and-wellness/diphtheria-tetanus-pertussis-whooping-cough-and-polio-tdap-ipv) & [Varicella](/en/information/health-and-wellness/varicella-chickenpox-vaccine) (if the child has not had two doses) Grade 6 [HPV](/en/information/health-and-wellness/human-papillomavirus-hpv-vaccine-gardasilr-9) (for girls and boys) Grade 9 [T](/en/information/health-and-wellness/tetanus-diphtheria-pertussis-whooping-cough-vaccine-tdap-or-dtap) [dap](/en/information/health-and-wellness/tetanus-diphtheria-pertussis-whooping-cough-vaccine-tdap-or-dtap) & [Meningococcal A, C, Y and W-135 Conjugate](/en/information/health-and-wellness/meningococcal-group-c-y-and-w-135-conjugate-vaccine) Students in post-secondary school and living in residence [Meningococcal B](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/en/information/health-and-wellness/meningococcal-group-a-b-c-y-and-w-135-vaccines) Legend DTaP-HB-IPV-Hib = Diphtheria, Tetanus, Pertussis, Hepatitis B, Polio, Haemophilus influenza type B acellular Pertussis IPV = Inactive Polio Virus How can I find out if my family's vaccinations are up to date? Call the [Health PEI Public Health Nursing office](/en/information/health-pei/public-health-nursing) in your area and speak with the Public Health Nurse to determine if your family's vaccinations are up to date. If you moved to PEI from another province or country, your immunizations may have been different. You can have the schedules reviewed by a Public Health Nurse. How can I receive a written copy of my vaccination record? Vaccination records can be obtained by contacting the local [Health PEI Public Health Nursing office](/en/information/health-pei/public-health-nursing) in your area. There is no fee for this service. The application process takes approximately two weeks. The [CANImmunize](https://www.canimmunize.ca/en/home) free smartphone app allows you to securely manage your families' vaccination records and appointments and is customized to PEI's provincial immunization schedule.
